item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S11439)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S11437-11438, S11439)

summary.text: Bankruptcy Prevention Credit Counseling Act of 2005 - Amends federal bankruptcy law governing allowance of claims or interests to direct the court to allow a claim to which an objection has been raised, except to the extent that the consumer debt is an unsecured claim arising from a debt to a creditor that does not have a policy of waiving additional interest for all debtors who participate in a debt management plan administered by a nonprofit budget and credit counseling agency.

bill.title: Bankruptcy Prevention Credit Counseling Act of 2005

item.title: Bankruptcy Prevention Credit Counseling Act of 2005
A bill to amend title 11, United States Code, to limit claims in bankruptcy by certain unsecured creditors.
Bankruptcy Prevention Credit Counseling Act of 2005

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S11439)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
